Title.En: Hydrogen and Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF) – Key Factors for Carbon-Free Aviation?

Description.En:
Hydrogen and SAF have great potential to contribute to the decarbonization of industry and transport. One sector in which hydrogen and SAF are expected to play an important role is aviation. Aircraft manufacturers, airlines and airports are developing new technologies and utilization concepts. Hamburg Airport, for example, is preparing for the future use of hydrogen and SAF.  

But is it realistic to believe that we are moving towards a carbon-free aviation? What are the limiting factors? What ideas do you have for designing an efficient and reliable hydrogen and SAF supply system?  

Many factors need to be considered and can be analyzed in this challenge. Be part of this journey and get to know Airbus', HAM Airport’s and DLR’s current plans and visions, work on alternatives and scenarios that you consider important and bring in your own creativity.  

Experience working in an international group under the supervision of the teamchers and industry stakeholders. Present your results and ideas to the others.  

Whether you focus on one detail or think bigger – your ideas will make a difference.

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of the course, the participants will be able to work effectively and confidently within an international team.
By the end of the course, participants will be competent to prepare professional reports and presentations in a group in English.

Title.En: Finding Innovative Approaches for Hydrogen and SAF and Evaluating Them

NoteLiteral.En: Participants will be able to identify specific challenges in hydrogen and SAF infrastructure and supply networks, develop innovative solutions, and evaluate their practicality.

Title.En: Recognizing Challenges and Opportunities of Hydrogen and SAF Use

PrefLabel.En: promote the use of sustainable transport

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of the course, participants will understand the opportunities and challenges of using hydrogen and SAF as alternative fuels for sustainable aviation.

Title.En: Hydrogen and Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF) – Key Factors for Carbon-Free Aviation?
Hydrogen and Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF) – Key Factors for Carbon-Free Aviation?

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
In this course we will embark on a joint learning journey: In interdisciplinary and international teams, we will familiarize ourselves with the multi-layered future topic of hydrogen and SAF in the field of aviation. Along the way, representatives from Airbus, HAM Airport, DLR will join us to share their experiences and give us feedback based on their experience and in-depth background knowledge.  

**Dates:**

**April 14/15** (2 days) – Initial meeting (in Hamburg/hybrid): This meeting will take place in Hamburg, but we will offer hybrid access for those who cannot travel to Hamburg. After getting to know each other, you will get input on the problem and how to systematically work in a project. In addition, we are planning a trip to Hamburg Airport (only in person). Also, you will form your teams and decide on the project subject.  

**April, 25 - btw 10 am to 2 pm** (all groups) – Challenge Formulation Meeting (Online): After a further week, the teams will determine the details of their topics and will present their problem descriptions and the potential approaches to the problem in this meeting.  

**May, dates TBA** (1 hour each team) -  Reflection session (Online): Here, we are meeting the teams separately. We will be talking about your progress, checking how teamwork functions and providing feedback to help prepare for the Q&A session.  

**May, 19 - btw 4 pm to 5.30 pm** (all groups) -  Q&A-session (Online): You have the opportunity to ask your questions about your projects to our industry experts from Airbus, HAM Airport and DLR.  

**June, 6 - from 9 am to 2 pm** (all groups) - Interim presentations (Online): You have the chance to present your current state of your projects and get feedback about content and presentation skills.  

**June, 10 - (end of the day) -** Hand in your question lists for the experts (Written): If you still have open questions for industry experts, you can write them in an email to your teamchers. We hope to deliver answers of your questions in 1 week.  

**June, 30 - (end of the day)** – Deadline for your written reports  

**July, 10 - from 3 pm to 6 pm** – Final Presentation (in Hamburg/hybrid): You are going to present your ideas in Hamburg (or hybrid) to teamchers, TUHH professors and industry experts from Airbus, HAM Airport and DLR.

**Evaluation:**

After the final event, we will hold individual evaluation sessions with each team between (11th - 18th July).

**Travel costs:**

Train tickets for the Hamburg Airport visit will be covered by us. Besides, we serve pizza, snacks and drinks for our hybrid meetings. Please contact your home institution, about your other expenses (tickets from/to Hamburg and accommodation etc.). Use the contact form at the end of the engage page and choose option "I have a question about mobility support". Before applying, please make sure that you are available at the dates described above.
Explore future scenarios for refueling infrastructure and supply networks, with Airbus, Hamburg Airport and the German aerospace centre (DLR)

Hydrogen and SAF have great potential to decarbonize industry and transportation, with aviation being a key sector. Aircraft manufacturers, airlines, and airports are advancing technologies and utilization concepts. For example, Hamburg Airport is preparing for future hydrogen operations. But is carbon-free aviation truly achievable? What are the limiting factors? How can we develop an efficient and reliable supply system for both hydrogen and SAF?

We welcome all master’s students, who are interested in or curious about renewable energies, sustainable aviation infrastructures, and supply chains. We particularly encourage students with a background in engineering and/or business to apply, but we welcome all other disciplines as well. Questions about the course itself will be answered by the teamcher. Please send your questions to <akin.oegruek@tuhh.de>

To apply please send your CV, your transcript of records and a letter of motivation. Make sure that all your documents are in English.

All students who pass will receive a certificate (Micro-credential) from ECIU University. Active participation and attendance (online or on campus) is strongly suggested and has an impact on pass/fail decisions.

**For TUHH-students:**Please note that you can receive TUHH credits in your Master's program only via the corresponding NTA course for which you must register at TUHH (choose: Join Standard Challenges of the ECIU University from the NTA course catalogue).
